title: Google\Cloud\Dataproc\V1\BasicYarnAutoscalingConfig
name: BasicYarnAutoscalingConfig
description:
Basic autoscaling configurations for YARN.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.dataproc.v1.BasicYarnAutoscalingConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.graceful_decommission_timeout
params.description: Required. Timeout for YARN graceful decommissioning of Node Managers. Specifies the duration to wait for jobs to complete before forcefully removing workers (and potentially interrupting jobs). Only applicable to downscaling operations. Bounds: [0s, 1d].

params.name: data.scale_up_factor
params.description: Required. Fraction of average YARN pending memory in the last cooldown period for which to add workers. A scale-up factor of 1.0 will result in scaling up so that there is no pending memory remaining after the update (more aggressive scaling). A scale-up factor closer to 0 will result in a smaller magnitude of scaling up (less aggressive scaling). See How autoscaling works for more information. Bounds: [0.0, 1.0].

params.name: data.scale_down_factor
params.description: Required. Fraction of average YARN pending memory in the last cooldown period for which to remove workers. A scale-down factor of 1 will result in scaling down so that there is no available memory remaining after the update (more aggressive scaling). A scale-down factor of 0 disables removing workers, which can be beneficial for autoscaling a single job. See How autoscaling works for more information. Bounds: [0.0, 1.0].

params.name: data.scale_up_min_worker_fraction
params.description: Optional. Minimum scale-up threshold as a fraction of total cluster size before scaling occurs. For example, in a 20-worker cluster, a threshold of 0.1 means the autoscaler must recommend at least a 2-worker scale-up for the cluster to scale. A threshold of 0 means the autoscaler will scale up on any recommended change. Bounds: [0.0, 1.0]. Default: 0.0.

params.name: data.scale_down_min_worker_fraction
params.description: Optional. Minimum scale-down threshold as a fraction of total cluster size before scaling occurs. For example, in a 20-worker cluster, a threshold of 0.1 means the autoscaler must recommend at least a 2 worker scale-down for the cluster to scale. A threshold of 0 means the autoscaler will scale down on any recommended change. Bounds: [0.0, 1.0]. Default: 0.0.

methods.name: getGracefulDecommissionTimeout
methods.description:
Required. Timeout for YARN graceful decommissioning of Node Managers.

Specifies the duration to wait for jobs to complete before forcefully removing workers (and potentially interrupting jobs). Only applicable to downscaling operations. Bounds: [0s, 1d].

Generated from protobuf field .google.protobuf.Duration graceful_decommission_timeout = 5 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = REQUIRED];

methods.name: getScaleUpFactor
methods.description:
Required. Fraction of average YARN pending memory in the last cooldown period for which to add workers. A scale-up factor of 1.0 will result in scaling up so that there is no pending memory remaining after the update (more aggressive scaling). A scale-up factor closer to 0 will result in a smaller magnitude of scaling up (less aggressive scaling).

See How autoscaling works for more information. Bounds: [0.0, 1.0].

Generated from protobuf field double scale_up_factor = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = REQUIRED];
